title: brits are losing hundreds of pounds in benefits because universal credit it systems are in tatters
story: The new flagship benefits system is riddled with flaws that are guaranteed to make mistakes which are pushing people into debt.Workers in the service centres have spoken out about the glitched and errors that the system has, which are repeatedly leading to benefits being delayed for weeks, or wrongly slashed, the  reported.One said: The IT system on which universal credit is built is so fundamentally broken and poorly designed that it guarantees severe problems with claims.They claimed the systems were overly complex, prone to breaking, and any errors were slow to fix.It is not working the way it was intended and it is having an actively harmful effect on a huge number of claimants, they added.One whistleblower said many of the design problems with Universal Credit punished claimants for not understanding a system that is not built with them in mind.Another, Bayard Tapley, who had worked at the Grimsby service centre for two years, described a slew of problems the Universal Credit systems were having.He told of how staff arent notified when claimants leave messages on their online account, leaving them hanging on for weeks, callers are often given different or wrong advice by different members of staff, and many are being asked to post documents, further slowing down the process.Mistakes and delays can add an average of three weeks to a wait for a first benefits payment - which are pushing people into debt and to food banks.Three million people still have to get transferred on to the new system in the next year, prompting fears the problems will only get worse.Universal Credit aims to replace six benefits with one monthly payment, but its already years behind schedule.A damning audit report claimed one in five people were experiencing delays and it was costing four times as much to run as it was promised.Between January and October last year, 20,000 households were forced to wait around 11 weeks and another 10,000 waited almost five months or more for their first payment.Alternative Payment Arrangements- If youre falling behind on rent, you or your landlord may be able to apply for an APA which will get your payment sent directly to your landlord. You might also be able to change your payments to get them more frequently , or you can split the payments if youre part of a couple.Budgeting Advance - You may be able to get help from the government to help with emergency household costs of up to £348 if youre single, £464 if youre part of a couple or £812 if you have children. These are only in cases like your cooker breaking down or for help getting a job. Youll have to repay the advance through your regular Universal Credit payments. Youll still have to repay the loan, even if you stop claiming for Universal Credit.Cut your Council Tax - You might be able to get a discount on your Council Tax or be entitled to Discretionary Housing Payments if your payments arent enough to cover your rent.Foodbanks - If youre really hard up and struggling to buy food and toiletries, you can find your local foodbank who will provide you with help for free. You can find your nearest one on the Trussel Trust website.The Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey has admitted there are problems with the system but is determined to continue with the rollout.A spokesperson from the DWP said: Universal credit is a flexible and responsive benefit and we continue to listen to feedback and make any necessary improvements during the rollout with our test-and-learn approach.We are committed to ensuring people get the help they need and the majority of staff say universal credit gives them greater flexibility to give people the right support. The latest figures show 83% of claimants are satisfied with the system and complaint rates are low.

title: shocking moment female passenger wees on the floor of a wizz air flight from britain to poland because the toilet was engaged
story: The woman is seen relieving herself on the flight from London Luton to Warsaw while complaining that she was not allowed to use the toilet during take off.According to reports, the plane was fuelling up and passengers were temporarily forbidden from using the loo.In the shocking footage, the young woman is seen squatting against a wall while chatting with a friend on the phone.By her feet are several paper towels and a large pool of urine.With her knickers and leggings pulled down to her knees, she tells the person on the phone: You have to help me before the flight takes off. I am peeing in the aircraft.I asked them (cabin crew) if I could use the toilet, but they said I could not right now. So I am peeing in the galley. Right in front of them.The brazen woman adds: The police are coming because it is my fault. All my fault.Cabin crew members can be heard berating the woman, with one saying: Are you being serious? That is disgusting. You are a grown woman.The passenger replies: Yeh, I know. I did ask.The man then adds: So you think it is okay to piss on the floor?There is still no confirmation as to what happened to woman after the police arrived.Wizz Air is a Hungarian low-cost airline that serves many cities across Europe as well as some destinations in North Africa and the Middle East.A spokesperson for the airline said: “On Wizz Air flight W6 1309 from Warsaw to London Luton a passenger was reported to become unruly during landing, ignoring crew instructions.“The cabin crew handled the situation as they are trained to do and reported the passenger’s behaviour to the respective authorities.“After disembarkation, while waiting for the authorities’ arrival, the situation escalated.“The aircraft was refuelling and therefore the lavatories could not be used, as is standard procedure.“As a result, the passenger’s behaviour became aggressive and offensive towards the crew.“Safety is our top priority and the airline has zero tolerance for abusive behaviour. This is now a matter for the police.”

title: bum lift operation kim kardashian gone wrong
story: Velislava Grigorieva is planning to sue the plastic surgery clinic where she had the op after he bum was left permanently disfigured. The 40-year-old, from Surgut in central Russia, underwent liposuction to get rid of her belly fat and lipofilling to transfer the fat to her buttocks.Velislava visited the Centre for Cosmetology and Plastic Surgery, founded by Dr Sergey Nudelman, where the procedure took place.“When I woke up the next morning, I saw a liquid that was leaking through the skin on my bum,” she claimed.“My right buttock and waist were black. But the doctor said that everything was good.”Five days later Velislava was discharged from the clinic, despite the fact that she was in a lot of pain, and the doctor advised her to undergo massage therapy and spend few weeks by the sea.But over the next few months the situation worsened and Grigorieva decided to visit a clinic in Moscow where doctors found a huge amount of pus in her right bum cheek.There doctors told her the pus was due to inflammation in the tissue caused by the lipofilling surgery.Medics had to remove part of her bum to stop the spread of infection and she was left with a huge hole in her right bum cheek for two months.“My life changed. I cant take a bath, drive my car or work,” she said.“I have to buy three plane tickets to have a flight. I cant sit - I can only lie.“I feel like a helpless disfigured woman. Im just in despair.”Police have reportedly started investigating the clinic after learning of Velislava’s ordeal.Police spokesman Aleksandr Shulga said: “Officers are now checking the clinic.“A forensic medical examination will be carried out to determine the severity of the harm caused to the womans health.”The clinic has been contacted but was unable to comment on ongoing cases.

title: theresa may no deal brexit sun says
story: If that’s the case then surely we won’t be conceding any more to Brussels.The evidence on Friday — when the EU slapped down Theresa May’s Chequers offers — suggests otherwise.Hammond’s disparaging remark shows that Remainers are at the heart of Theresa May’s Government, running the show at the expense of Leave voices.This Government sees Brexit as a damage-limitation exercise rather than a golden opportunity for Britain to reinvent itself as a global and buccaneering free nation.How can we ever achieve Brexit in full if the Government itself is so institutionally Euro-phile? Enough is enough.It is clear Mrs May needs to change her approach to Brexit - and fast.The PM has repeatedly said: “No deal is better than a bad deal”.She must be true to her words — and properly start planning for such a scenario.BRITAIN is in the midst of a jobs boom.But you wouldn’t think it listening to all the Remoaner doom and gloom.Project Fear claimed more than 800,000 jobs could go within two years of a Leave vote.Instead, 610,000 have been added.That shows the continuing resilience of our country and strength of our economy.It is also testament to the resolve of hard-working, ordinary Brits who roll up their sleeves and get on with it.Shame our politicians seem incapable of doing the same.THIS is the weekend of traffic hell as families make their escapes for the summer holidays.But the sun is shining and schools are out so there’s plenty to be cheerful about.There is also a free bottle of Tetley’s Super Squash with your favourite newspaper today.Summer is always better with The Sun on Sunday.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: ivf treatment being rationed as providers struggle to fund it
story: Campaign group Fertility Fairness says the number of CCGs in England meeting those guidelines has gone down, from 24% in 2013 to 12% in 2017, and only four offer what Fertility Network UK calls the "gold standard" of three full IVF cycles, even for couples who have children from previous relationships.Aileen Feeney, the chief executive of Fertility Network UK, said: "We believe that there should be fair access."NICE guidelines are there because financially and medically they are the best way to achieve the outcome that you want."So, therefore, we believe that everywhere in the UK should be offering those in line with the NICE guidelines, so three full cycles of IVF."Emma Edey and her husband Lee say they are victims of these geographical differences.Both have health problems that doctors agree would make natural conception difficult, but they live in north east Essex, one of seven areas in England where all NHS IVF treatment has been removed or suspended - and they cannot afford to pay for private treatment. When Mrs Edey appealed to her local CCG last year, saying that her bowel disease means she is in "exceptional circumstances", she was refused.

title: pm takes cabinet north for brexit away day
story: Claiming some of his fellow Tory MPs are "actively seeking" a no deal outcome from EU divorce negotiations, Mr Grieve insisted he was not "scaremongering" about the impact of such an outcome.He told Sky News' Sophy Ridge on Sunday show: "We've got to be realistic about this. We will be in a state of emergency.:: 'No deal' Brexit would see UK state of emergency, warns Dominic Grieve"Basic services that we take for granted might not be available."It wouldn't be possible, for example, for someone to fly to Rome because the overflying rights over the other countries of the EU are regulated by EU law.Former prime minister Sir John Major also backed a new Brexit vote, as he attacked the "irreconcilable" attitude of Tory Brexiteers for having "boxed the government and particularly the prime minister into a corner" which could lead to no deal "by accident".He told the BBC: "It has downsides. I mean, frankly, a second vote has democratic downsides. It has difficulties."But is it morally justified? I think it is."If you look back at the Leave campaign a great many of the promises they made were fantasy promises. We now know they are not going to be met."The Prime Minister hopes Monday's cabinet visit to the north east will be seen as a commitment to regional development post-Brexit.The meeting will see announcements of backing for technology and manufacturing development in the region.

title: top job opens in romania but no candidates apply
story: Justice minister Tudorel Toader, who engineered Ms Kovesi's departure, suggested potential candidates had not applied because they believed the selection process was rigged - with Mr Toader stressing that this is not the case.He also suspects prosecutors do not want the job because they know how much work is necessary to make Romania's Anti-Corruption Directorate (known as DNA for short) function well.Ms Kovesi's dismissal raised concerns at home and abroad about the country's commitment to fighting corruption - with critics saying it was a bid by the government to rein in the anti-corruption fight.Upon her appointment in 2006, Ms Kovesi was the first woman and the youngest prosecutor general in Romania's history.Mr Toader accused Ms Kovesi of being authoritarian - claiming prosecutors under her command had falsified evidence and that an inordinate number of defendants had been acquitted.Under Ms Kovesi's leadership, the DNA made notable progress against high-level corruption - prosecuting dozens of mayors, five MPs, two ex-ministers and former prime minister Victor Ponta in 2014 alone.Ponta came under a DNA criminal investigation in July 2015 for forgery and money laundering.

title: boy who silent until seven
story: NewsA boy who was silent until he was seven because of severe cerebral palsy has got a message for youJonathan Bryan is on a campaign to change perceptions after he was continually underestimated by the education system.&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent12:31, 23 JUL 2018Updated12:35, 23 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA nine-year-old boy who was silent until he was seven because of his severe cerebral palsy has written a book. Jonathan Bryan is on a campaign to change people's perceptions about disability after he was continually underestimated by the education system. Jonathan, who communicates by moving his eyes, has a message that he wants people to hear -never underestimate us. But, despite his bravery, he has had huge hurdles to overcome in his short life.  Mum Chantal, who has been instrumental in fighting for him to have the opportunities he deserves, said that she was unprepared for the level of discrimination he has face. She said that the discrimination he's faced has been some of the hardest things to overcome.  Lots of people look at Jonathan and because his body doesn’t work very well, they assume his mind doesn’t too, she said. Jonathan entered the special education system with the label Profound and Multiple Learning Difficulties (PMLD), as a result he was given a largely sensory curriculum (focused on stimulating the senses). Chantal explained: He did lots of different activities at school, but had no formal literacy teaching.  She said that he was acutely aware that people were talking to him differently. Jonathan describes being talked to in “special” a mixture of the voice reserved for a baby mixed with how you talk to a foreigner with little understanding: slow, loud and clear with short sentence, she said. People often assumed that he would not understand if they talked to him normally. When he was seven Chantal decided to keep him at home for a few hours everyday to teach him to read and write. After a year and a half it got to the stage where he was able to say everything he wanted to using an alphabet board.  Jonathan describes “speaking” for the first time saying “I felt like a bird let out of its cage.” His mum said: When recovering from a serious illness a year after starting to spell in 2016, Jonathan said he had been given extra time to be a 'voice for the voiceless', and began campaigning for all children to be given the opportunity to learn to read, write and spell, regardless of their educational label.  Since then he has gone on to set up a charity to challenge educational assumptions and write and publish his memoir, Eye Can Write, ( http://bit.ly/EyeCanWrite ) with his proceeds going to his charity, Teach Us Too ( www.teachustoo.org.uk ).  The strong-willed youngster is keen to share his important message: “Never underestimate us, teach us to read and write.”  He and mum Chantal are working with the Department For International Development to spread that message. She said: Jonathan’s journey has not been an easy one, and as his mother it has often felt a lonely one. But in many countries in the world the stigma that people face is even more acute and there is far less support available.  Chantal and Jonathan are supporting the UK Government’s first-ever Global Disability Summit in London to galvanise the global effort to transform the lives of people with disabilities.  International Development Secretary Penny Mordaunt said: For too long many people with disabilities in the world’s poorest countries have not been able to fulfil their potential due to stigma or a lack of practical support.

title: brexit could spark civil unrest
story: NewsBrexit could spark 'civil unrest' within two weeks warns boss of AmazonDoug Gurr allegedly made the shock comment to the Brexit Secretary during a business retreat at his grace-and-favour stately home Chevening&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByDan BloomPolitical reporter08:45, 23 JUL 2018Updated13:18, 23 JUL 2018NewsPolice during the 2011 riots - the last outbreak of major civil unrest in the UK (Image: PA)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA No Deal Brexit could spark civil unrest within just two weeks, the UK head of Amazon has warned. Doug Gurr allegedly made the shock comment to the Brexit Secretary during a business retreat at his grace-and-favour stately home Chevening. Tory Dominic Raab is said to have been told the doomsday scenario was part of the warehouse giant's planning for leaving the EU without a deal. A source revealed the comment to the Times, saying: People seem to feel marginally more positive than when they went in. Let’s hope so, given that one of the people there with a significant supply chain had civil unrest within two weeks in their no-deal planning.”  Questioned by the Mirror, Amazon did not deny the comment was made. Instead a spokesman said: Like any business, we consider a wide range of scenarios in planning discussions so that we’re prepared to continue serving customers and small businesses who count on Amazon, even if those scenarios are very unlikely. It comes just days after the government stepped up plans for a No Deal Brexit as 12 weeks tick down to Britain needing a deal in October.  Asked if the Amazon boss was right to warn about civic unrest, Prime Minister Theresa May's deputy spokeswoman said: We've been clear that we expect to agree a mutually beneficial deal given all the progress we've made so far that is by far the most likely outcome. The spokeswoman added: Where is the evidence to suggest that would happen?  Today Theresa May will grapple with her battling Cabinet as she sweeps her top Tories to an away day in Gateshead. In a bid to give ministers a break from Brexit, she will also announce a &pound780m infrastructure investment in the East Coast rail line. But she faces other Brexit doomsday warnings - including that food safety controls could have to be suspended to stop Brits going hungry.  Yesterday pro-EU Tory Dominic Grieve warned No Deal will prompt a state of emergency - as Mr Raab refused to deny Britain plans to stockpile food. Mr Raab, who was made Brexit Secretary just two weeks ago, also refused to deny the M26 motorway could be turned into a lorry park to deal with a blockage at UK ports. Mr Raab insisted Britain was still preparing for No Deal. And a German minister today signalled Brussels will push Britain to make its Brexit plan even softer - risking a revolt by Tory Brexiteers.

title: jeremy corbyn braced crunch labour
story: NewsJeremy Corbyn braced for crunch Labour anti-Semitism meeting as veteran MP Margaret Hodge calls in her lawyersDame Margaret Hodge - who faces investigation for branding Mr Corbyn an anti-Semite to his face - claimed "many" people think he is anti-Semitic&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByDan BloomPolitical reporter10:05, 23 JUL 2018Updated12:44, 23 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailJeremy Corbyn is braced for a crunch meeting of MPs over anti-Semitism after Labour veteran Margaret Hodge stood by an attack on him and called in her lawyers. Dame Margaret - who faces investigation for branding Mr Corbyn an anti-Semite to his face - insisted many shared that view of the Labour leader. Today her lawyers wrote to Labour's general secretary, accusing party chiefs of a veiled attempt to silence her and branding the probe into her conduct sloppy, baseless and ill-thought-out. And she warned she'd been branded a Zionist bitch who was under the orders of my paymaster in Israel by trolls ahead of tonight's showdown. The row began when Labour's ruling NEC failed to adopt the full International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) definition of anti-Semitism.  Jeremy Corbyn insisted party chiefs had accepted almost all of it while Nick Thomas-Symonds, the shadow solicitor general, said parts of Labour's approach were much stronger.    But some Labour MPs are expected to back the full IHRA code tonight at the last meeting of the Parliamentary Labour Party before their summer break.  Labour MPs Louise Ellman and Ruth Smeeth are expected to move a motion backing the full code, followed by a debate. A vote would only be held on the first day back after the recess in September. Labour officials were refusing to say this morning whether Mr Corbyn would attend tonight's PLP meeting. Sources including MPs did not expect him to show up. It came as Dame Margaret's lawyers Mishcon de Reya wrote to Labour's general secretary Jennie Formby today - blasting the hasty, sloppy, baseless and ill-thought-out investigation into her conduct. Party chiefs wrote to Dame Margaret last week, the day after her outburst, saying she was being probed for an alleged beach of Labour's Rule 2.1.8 - which says no member should behave in a way that's grossly detrimental to the party. The party letter warned: You should be aware that any future behaviour of a similar nature to the allegation above could result in further disciplinary action, including the possibility of administrative suspension while the matter is investigated.  But Dame Margaret's lawyers' letter, seen by the Mirror, says the exact rule the MP is accused of breaking hasn't been specified, and threats to suspend her if she repeats it appear to be a veiled attempt to silence her. The letter adds: It is a fundamental breach of natural justice and principles of fairness. You have left our client in the bizarre position whereby possible suspension is hanging over her for future unspecified behaviour. The letter - which sets a deadline of 4pm on Wednesday for a response - also says Dame Margaret vehemently denied swearing at the Labour leader during their confrontation. Labour's code explicitly endorses the IHRA's working definition of anti-Semitism and includes a list of behaviours likely to be regarded as anti-Semitic copied word-for-word from the international organisation's own document. But it omits four examples from the IHRA list:   Accusing Jewish people of being more loyal to Israel than their home country Claiming that Israel's existence as a state is a racist endeavour Requiring higher standards of behaviour from Israel than other nations and Comparing contemporary Israeli policies to those of the Nazis.  Labour insisted that while the examples are not reproduced word for word, they are covered in the new code. Yet Dame Margaret said Labour's code meant people can call be a Zionist bitch and not be disciplined.  Today Dame Margaret said by refusing to adopt the IHRA definition in full, Mr Corbyn had put himself in a position where he’s perceived by many to be anti-Semitic.  She compared his claims to be taking action to people who say I’m not a racist but - adding people have to be judged on their actions and not their words. Dame Margaret, who fought and won against the BNP in Barking, compared the swift response to her outburst to how long it had taken to discipline people accused of anti-Semitism in the party. Last night Labour’s leader in the Lords, Angela Smith, joined calls for the party to adopt the IHRA definition in full. But she said she doubted Dame Margaret would be rebuked. Baroness Smith said: Jeremy’s not exactly somebody who’s not used to harsh words on that.

title: 9 ideas keeping kids entertained
story: Advertorial9 ideas for keeping the kids entertained this summerSix weeks of summer holidays to fill? Here are some bike-focused ideas to keep everyone busy&nbspShareByHolly Thatcher15:25, 20 JUL 2018Updated10:56, 23 JUL 2018Advertorial&nbspShareGet politics updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailFive seconds after breakfast on the first day of the school holidays, you just know that you'll hear the words I'm bored from the little ones. So you'll need to have a few ideas up your sleeve to get through the next six weeks. The best way to keep everyone happy is to get outside as a family and enjoy nature and each other's company. So we've teamed up with Halfords and put together some ideas for summer activities that are centered around bikes. Hop on, we're going for a ride!  1) Teach little ones to ride   The gift of cycling lasts a lifetime. Early teens will love the freedom a bike offers and smaller children love the time they get to spend with you. Getting them confident on a bike from an early age will enthuse them about cycling. There's currently up to 30 per cent off bikes and accessories in the Halfords big summer cycling sale, so there's no time like the present to get started. A balance bike is great for mastering the basics. Little ones can learn braking and balance skills and before you know it they'll be ready to graduate to a proper bike, without the need for stabilisers.   Halfords has bikes for all ages, but check out the starter bikes like the Apollo Wizzer Balance Bike (&pound50, save &pound5). This bike provides a smooth ride and is easy to control, and has a hand brake so they don't have to stop with their feet. It also has an adjustable saddle height and pneumatic tyres providing full grip.   2) Parks   There's nothing like a park in the summer to make you appreciate the beauty of nature. Government statistics suggest that 37 million of us use them each year and the UK has an estimated 27,000 public parks,* so you shouldn't be short of choice. Parks are also a great location to teach your child to ride a bike, so our first suggestion is that you grab the kids and take a trip to a park near you.  Check out Sustrans’ site for more details about routes through parks. Many have traffic free routes that are suitable for all the family.      3) An even bigger park!  As well as the local parks you'll find in almost every town, city or village in the UK there are also amazing national parks, 15 in fact, across the UK. England has 10, Scotland two and Wales has three. These areas are spectacular places to visit on a bike and are the perfect place to teach children how to ride. There's up to 30% off bikes and accessories in the Halfords Big Summer Cycling Sale.   Places like Whinlatter Forest in the Lake District and the Preseli Hills in Pembrokeshire lend themselves to mountain biking. You can cycle on bridleways (look for the signs, or check online before you set off). Pack a light lunch and the Halfords XL Waterproof Picnic Blanket, currently half price at &pound10, and you're ready to picnic anywhere.      4) See something new   There’s lots of amazing sights to see on a bike, so have a look around for either a local spot or something a bit more far-flung. Consider places like Brighton Pavilion, which is built in Indo-Saracenic style, or head to Wales for Lake Vyrnwy's Gothic revival straining tower (it filters the reservoir water before it is sent on for purification).  If you want to find amazing places in the UK then check out the national tourist sites for England , Wales and Scotland . Match those up with some of the great routes on Sustrans and you'll have a smashing holiday enjoying scenery from around the UK.    If you don’t already have a bike rack for your car, then the Thule ProRide 591 is a great choice at just &pound85 (save &pound25). And if you're not sure where you need to drive to, the TomTom GO 5200 will help ensure it's a hassle free journey. It offers lifetime map updates and has amazing features like Wi-Fi and a built-in SIM and you'll get free traffic update over the internet too, for the life of the device. It's just &pound202.49, save &pound97.50.   5) Hit an off road trail   There's no better way to escape the daily grind than by heading to the country and taking your bike offroad. Lots of areas of woodland have off-road tracks for mountain bikers and they usually offer a variety of distances and are designed for all types of skill levels, so it shouldn’t be too intimidating.  Swinley Forest in Berkshire and Dunkeld Mountain Bike Trails, Scotland along with many, many more places across the UK offer trails for beginners and experts alike. Check Sustrans for ideas, or search online for beginner mountain biking.    There's no doubt you'll find off road biking exhilarating, so if you don't have a mountain bike already then consider the Carrera Sulcata Mountain Bike from Halfords, now just &pound297 (save &pound128).   6) Plan a big trip   Get your kids excited about a big trip somewhere on your bikes. Perhaps something you do as a family holiday during the summer break. But before then it's worth building up to it with some weekend rides. This will be helpful to learn what everyone's ability is and plan the routes you take on your big holiday. So start small with some routes around your neighbourhood. Make sure all the bikes are in good condition and that everything on them works as it should.  If you're unsure, book a Free Bike Check where a Halfords expert will perform 32 point inspection on your bike, giving you complete confidence without having to get your hands dirty. The inspection includes:   Frame, saddle &amp handlebar Wheels including tyres, rims, spokes and hubs Brake system including levers, calipers, pads and cables / hoses Drivetrain including gears, levers, chain, bottom bracket, cranks and cables  If they spot anything that needs attention, they can fix it too. Once you've got everyone excited it's time to plan the big adventure. Check out Sustrans for help planning routes and organisations like the Camping and Caravanning Club can help you track down places to stay nearby.  If you're going to drive to your destination, make sure you get a FREE Halfords Car Check which includes:   Bulb Check Wiper Blades Check Battery Check  Engine oil level check   Air conditioning check  Windscreen Chip Check Plus Free Screenwash Top Up  Book online at halfords or visit a store - there's no appointment necessary.  7) Cycle and camp  One lovely way to spend a weekend is to locate a campsite near some good cycling routes. Set up camp and each day head off for a new cycling experience. Sustrans has loads of routes in the National cycle Network all across the UK so you won't struggle to find something to ride along, no matter where you stay.   Once you've got a base camp set up you should be able to put together some decent lunches. Take a Halfords 40L Coolbox to keep food cool at the campsite (it runs on mains power, or from a car supply, but check if your campsite has power hookups) - it's &pound85 (save &pound25).      8) Take your toddler out       One of the nicest things you can do with very small children is to take them for a ride in a bike trailer - like the Halfords Double Child Bike Trailer , currently better than half price at just &pound100 (save &pound120). Don't worry, they'll be in safe and secure in tow behind you in this comfortable buggy. Safety and security is increased by the high visibility flag, safety harness, bug screen and rain shield.  Enjoy a relaxed riding experience with your children taking in all the sights and sounds together. They'll love the downhill parts - and will heckle you in the uphill sections!  Taking a little one out on a bike also means that you can get older kids out at the same time. No need to leave anyone at home, making for a wonderful family day out. story: NewsCouple, 22, foster teen just seven years younger than them - and she agrees to play very special role at their weddingSally-Ann and Ryan Jones from Warwickshire were both 22 when they made the huge decision to become foster carers&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByFionnula Hainey22:38, 22 JUL 2018Updated12:55, 23 JUL 2018NewsSally-Ann and Ryan who were both 22 when they took in the 15-year-old (Image: Coventry Live WS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A couple who fostered a teenager just seven years younger than them feel they have found their 'calling in life.' title: doctor who teaches students sepsis
story: NewsDoctor who teaches students about sepsis saved by brother who spotted his symptoms of deadly infectionDr Michael Porter developed the potentially life-threatening condition after infection spread from a cut in his hand he got from a nail on a garden gate&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByGary Carter12:13, 23 JUL 2018NewsProfessor Michael Porter (L) contracted sepsis and was saved by his brother, Martin (R) who rushed him to hospital (Image: Cascade)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA doctor who teaches students how to spot sepsis was saved by his brother who recognised his symptoms of the potentially life-threatening condition.  Dr Michael Porter developed sepsis after infection spread from a cut in his hand he got from a nail on a garden gate.  The blood poisoning was spreading through his body fogging his judgment in seeking urgent medical treatment.  But his brother Martin spotted the warning signs and rushed him to hospital.  Dr Porter slipped into a coma and his family feared the worst. But the 45-year-old fought his way back to health and is now raising awareness of what people should do if they suspect someone has sepsis. Dr Porter, a lecturer in molecular genetics, was visiting his family in Newton Mearns, East Renfrewshire, when he became ill. He said: Two days earlier I had been repairing the lock on my garden gate, when I scratched my hand on a nail. The University of Central Lancashire lecturer added: By the time I arrived in Glasgow I was feeling unwell, but I didn't know just how ill I really was. I was fevered, exhausted and must have come over slightly confused. All warning signs of sepsis. My armpit was also sore which I now realise was caused by the sepsis killing the muscles in my arm, in a process called necrotising myositis. The sepsis was spreading through my body from the cut and was impacting on my judgment on spotting the symptoms.  His brother Martin, an NHS consultant, took him to hospital and asked the most important question. He got me into a car and rushed me and my wife, Nicola, to Hairmyres Hospital, four miles away, said Dr Porter. “In A&ampE he asked the vital question, ‘Could it be sepsis?' That triggered a series of tests and treatments. It included immediate intravenous antibiotics to give me any chance of survival. There was no time to lose in trying to stop the runaway train of sepsis which was threatening to kill me. Dr Porter deteriorated so badly he slipped into a coma, which lasted three months. Nicola and the rest of his family were told he probably would not last the night. But he held on, despite having to be resuscitated several times over the next two weeks. Nicola and Martin and Michael's parents, Linda and Joe, could only watch from his bedside in ICU as his body failed. In a desperate bid to keep his vital organs working, medics hooked him up to artificial respiration and kidney dialysis.  His face and body were almost hidden by the network of wires and tubes keeping him alive. I remember vivid dreams in which I was willing myself to live, he said. I didn't want to leave my family. I didn't want to die. I was vaguely aware of what was going on around me but unable to emerge from the coma. I was so ill, my parents were considering arrangements for my funeral. All hope seemed to be lost. Nicola, 35, a university administrator, said: Michael was so ill that some of the nurses could barely make eye contact. Others were advising us that he was most likely going to die. We had only been married three years and I thought I would lose him. When Dr Porter emerged from the coma, he could hardly walk and his weight had fallen from 12 stone to seven. Most of his muscles had faded and he had to learn to walk again with the help of physiotherapists. But he fought his way back to health over a period of nine months. And shortly after, he returned to his university post.

title: hosepipe ban map reveals water
story: NewsHosepipe ban 2018: UK map shows where it's in place and what the rules arePeople around the country are being asked to conserve water as the heatwave continues&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByElaine McCahill12:45, 23 JUL 2018Updated13:04, 23 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMillions of Brits will soon find their areas subject to a hosepipe ban as the heatwave continues - but has your area been affected? Most water companies have advised customers to conserve water but some firms will introduce or continue with usage restrictions. United Utilities said the measure will be introduced to customers in the North West of England on August 5. The ban comes despite recent rainfall as the heatwave looks set to continue until at least the end of the month. Water services director Martin Padley said: “Reservoir levels are still lower than we would expect at this time of year. “It is not a decision we have taken lightly.”  United Utilities has seven million customers in the North West. It will apply to all residential customers except in Carlisle and the north Eden Valley, where supplies remain reasonable. Bosses hope it will reduce water usage by 5-10%, or 100 million litres per day. A hosepipe ban also remains in place in Northern Ireland despite significant rainfall on Sunday.  Despite 17mm falling in the village of Portglenone, Co. Antrim within a 24-hour period, daily water usage remains more than 60 million litres (11.3%) above what is normally required during the July holidays. NI Water said: Demand on our plants normally drops over the holiday period to around 530m litres a day, but over July 13 and 14 this year our plants were producing approximately 590m litres each day. There was an initial drop in demand after the hosepipe ban was introduced in June. However, with another warm spell on the way the ban will remain in place for the foreseeable future. The temporary ban makes it illegal for people to uses hosepipes or sprinklers. It also means people are not allowed to fill paddling or swimming pools, hose their lawn or clean cars, paths or patios with a hose. However, householders are still allowed to use a watering can to water their plants and a bucket and sponge to wash their cars. Thames Water told The Express said that running a hosepipe for an hour would use, on average, the same amount of water used by a family of four in an entire day. Those who breach the hosepipe ban could face a fine of &pound1,000. In an effort to conserve water, people have been asked to use recycled water from bath tubs or from buckets outside which capture any rainfall in their gardens or to wash their cars. As the heat wave continues, people are also being encouraged to have showers rather than baths.  At the end of June, Southern Water asked customers to make sure their showers last no longer than four minutes. As part of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010, utility companies can now limit any or all activities for as long as they think necessary. Other water firms in England and Wales say they have no plans to follow suit. Severn Trent Water, which serves the Midlands and mid-Wales, said reservoirs were in a “healthy position”. South Staffs Water, which supplies a million customers in the Midlands, had “no issues”. Anglian Water, Northumbrian Water, Bristol Water, Wessex Water, Welsh Water and Thames Water all said reservoir levels were where they should be.

title: mum reveals lives open minded
story: NewsMum reveals she lives with 'open minded' ex-husband and her new love in 'very modern' familyWhen Lindsay Taylor suddenly became homeless, her former husband Chris Kelley, 46, suggested they all move in together, as they were still on good terms&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByLucy BryantSarah Ward11:44, 22 JUL 2018Updated14:46, 22 JUL 2018NewsLindsay Taylor (centre) with daughter Joanna, new husband Mike Taylor, ex-husband Chris Kelley, and son Lucas (Image: Lindsay Taylor / SWNS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum has revealed her unusual living arrangement - which sees her share a house with her husband and her ex. Lindsay Taylor, 33, moved in with her ex after she and her husband suddenly became homeless. When Lindsay and new love, Mike Taylor, 50, suddenly became homeless, her open minded former husband Chris Kelley, 46, suggested they all move in together. Mum-of-four Lindsay describes it as “a very modern family” - and the two men now get on like a house on fire. She met Mike shortly after her daughter Joanna, now two, was born.  Knowing her marriage to Chris was over, Lindsay began divorce proceedings in 2016 but the couple remained on good terms. In July last year, Mike and Lindsay tied the knot in a beach ceremony, when she was pregnant with baby Harrison, now aged five months. Chris looked after their children, Joanna, and Lucas, five, who suffers from a rare immunodeficiency disorder, chronic granulomatous disease or CGD. Lucas’ stepsister Rachel, 17, who Lindsay gave birth to as a teenager, is finishing her final year of high school at home. Lindsay moved back in with her mum and began seeing Mike and soon they decided to move in together. But when they were evicted because the landlord was renting to them illegally, Chris suggested they all move into his five-bed house in Connecticut, USA.  Lindsay said: “We started to look for another place, but Chris made a suggestion that no-one was expecting. “He said: 'Why don't you both move in with me? We can pay one mortgage, one set of bills and keep all the kids together?'. “Chris is very open minded, so for him, this wasn’t a big deal at all – it just made sense.” Moving in with Chris also gave them both the chance to see their children every day. Lindsay added: “We were willing to do anything to keep the flow of our family going. “Mike found it quite hard. He’s more classic and not as ‘go with the flow’. “It took him a while to be comfortable in our blended home.”  The men quickly struck up a friendship and helped each other out with painting and decorating. Mike joked to Chris: I took your wife, the least I could do was paint your kitchen. In October last year, Lucas underwent a bone marrow transplant which it is hoped will regenerate his immune system and cure him of CGD. He needs to live in a semi-sterile environment, and the five-bed home the family share is ideal. Lindsay said: “Lucas is a complex kid that needs a village around him and this is what we’re doing. “It might seem a bit strange that I live with both my ex-husband and my husband, but it’s what we need to do to get through this as a family. “Lucas’ immune system is so fragile right now that we need to limit his exposure to the outside world, and this means as a family we need to do this as well. “We can go to the store and little things like that but we avoid large gatherings and restaurants where we can easily pick up infections and pass them on to Lucas. “It’s a big sacrifice that everyone is making but hopefully it will all be for the best when Lucas gets better.” Cinema manager Chris has taken leave from work to care for Lucas, while Lindsay extended her maternity leave from her job. Mike also took leave from work to dedicate his time to his family, including Destiny Taylor, 20, and Danny Taylor, 19, who live with their grandparents a few doors down. Lindsay explained: “It was during the end of my pregnancy with Joanna that mine and Chris' marriage began to break down.

story: NewsWaitrose removes coleslaw salad from shelves because it contains deadly listeria bacteriaCustomers who purchased the own brand coleslaw have been warned not to consume it amid fears it could make them ill&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByChris kitching11:07, 23 JUL 2018Updated11:23, 23 JUL 2018NewsThe own brand Crisp &amp Creamy Deli Style Coleslaw Side Salad that has been recalled&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Waitrose has pulled a packaged coleslaw side salad from its shelves because it contains potentially deadly listeria bacteria.  Customers who purchased the own brand Crisp &amp Creamy Deli Style Coleslaw Side Salad have been warned not to consume it amid fears it could make them severely ill. Listeriosis symptoms are similar to the flu and can include vomiting, diarrhoea and a high temperature, but some cases can lead to severe complications including meningitis. The 220g coleslaw product - with use-by dates of 20/21/22/23 July - should be returned to the upmarket supermarket chain for a full refund.  Waitrose said no other products are known to be affected by the bug. It warned customers in a notice online and in stores: Waitrose is recalling the product as a precaution due to the potential presence of listeria. The product must not be consumed, but returned to Waitrose for a full refund. We apologise for the inconvenience caused. Waitrose and the Food Standards Agency (FSA) have both issued alerts to warn customers.   The FSA wrote on its website: Waitrose is recalling Crisp &amp Creamy Deli Style Coleslaw Side Salad because listeria has been found in the product. No other Waitrose products are known to be affected. Symptoms caused by this organism can be similar to flu and include high temperature, muscle ache or pain, chills, feeling or being sick and diarrhoea. However, in rare cases, the infection can be more severe, causing serious complications, such as meningitis. Some people are more vulnerable to listeria infections, including those over 65 years of age, pregnant women and their unborn babies, babies less than one month old and people with weakened immune systems.

title: 10 signs your house haunted
story: News10 signs your house is haunted, according to a paranormal investigatorThe experts from Help! My House is Haunted have shared their advice on the things we should be looking out for&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByZoe ForseyAudience Writer13:13, 23 JUL 2018NewsDo you believe in ghosts? (Image: EyeEm Premium)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDo you ever feel you're being watched? Or feel sudden and unexplained changes in temperature? Well, we don't mean to worry you, but according to paranormal investigators this might mean your house is haunted. Sorry. According to new research, six in ten people believe in ghosts and 23 per cent of us think there are spooky goings on in our homes. And it could actually end up costing people a huge amount of money, as more than half of us would be put off buying a property if the previous owner had reported paranormal activity. Experts Barri Ghai, Sandy Lakdar and Chris Fleming will be addressing the issue in a new TV show Help! My House is Haunted.  Ahead of the release, they've shared a list of the ten things to look out for if you think your house might be haunted. They are:   Feeling of being watched when alone     Feeling a sudden and inexplicable change in temperature or a sudden static/electrical charge in the air     Household objects mysteriously disappearing and then reappearing in different places     Hearing unexplained whispers, footsteps, thuds or someone calling your name     Seeing shadows or movements out the corner of your eye     Frequent electrical problems such as lights inexplicably turning on or off, or appliances not working or acting up     Feeling of being touched by unseen hands     Unusual smells such as unexplained perfume scents, flowers, cigars, cigarettes, food or even the stench of death and decay     Waking up unexpectedly between 3am and 4am and sensing dread, fear or feeling like you're being watched    Feeling of grief or sadness in specific rooms or areas of the house  The research, which was carried out by leading statistician Dr Geoff Ellis to mark the release of the new show, found 39 per cent of people have reported seeing a ghost and 67 per cent claim they know someone who has. Bizarrely, 64 per cent of people believe their pets can see ghosts.  They team analysed the sale price of 25 British haunted houses that have been sold in the last 50 years and compared the sale prices to those of similar properties without any supernatural history.    The study revealed that well over half of the respondents (55 per cent) say they'd be put off buying a haunted house, whilst 28 per cent of British property buyers have felt a spooky presence when viewing a house, which has put them off buying.

title: swimming pigs bahamas fed booze
story: NewsSwimming pigs of the Bahamas 'fed booze by tourists, forced to do tricks and burnt by sun'The pigs on Major Big Cay island have a steady stream of food from adoring tourists and plenty of room to run around - but there are claims their life is not as sunny as it seems&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByRachel Bishop10:37, 23 JUL 2018NewsThe swimming pigs of the Bahamas have become famous (Image: iStockphoto)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSwimming with pigs in beautiful, crystal clear Caribbean waters, under glorious blue skies, seems like a dream come true for many people. And for the inquisitive animals, it doesn't seem like a terrible life either - with plenty of room to run around in the glistening sunshine. The pigs have some famous neighbours in the luxurious Exumas - a stretch of 365 cays and islands in the Bahamas, where A-listers own private islands. They have a steady stream of food from adoring tourists who arrive on their uninhabited island by boat, as well as easy access to the cooling sea. But there are claims that 'Pig Island' is not as sunny as it may seem.  The pigs on Major Big Cay island - which are wild but have become used to human contact - have reportedly been seen sunburnt and covered in cuts. Visitors have claimed that excited tourists pick them up and make them do tricks, with some holidaymakers allegedly even feeding the creatures booze. There are also reports of the animals biting visitors - a sign that could mean they are stressed and upset, according to experts. Over the years, the pigs have become celebrities in their own right thanks to glitzy snaps posted on social media by tourists and stars. How they ended up on the island is a bit of a mystery.  Related video: Bella Thorne plays with the swimming pigs of the Bahamas   Some say they were left by a group of sailors, who planned to come back and cook them and others claim the pigs swam over from a shipwreck nearby. Other 'pig islands' have popped up as people have seen the huge amount of tourism Major Big Cay gets from the creatures. But as the animal's popularity has grown so too have fears over their treatment, with the pigs reportedly having been fed beer, rum and other alcohol. Last February, the island made headlines around the globe when at least seven pigs were found dead. An official investigation led by the government found in March that they had died due to ingesting sand. Kim Aranha, the President of the Bahamas Humane Society, last year called for the release of a report on the investigation.   Kim told Tribune 242 that local tour operators are respectful of the pigs, but that silly tourists showing up on other boats can cause harm to the animals.  I know there are a lot of silly sailors that go and feed them alcohol to try and get them drunk but that’s not to mistake them with the tour operators based out of Nassau who have treated them with excellent care, she said. Wayde Nixon, one of the owners responsible for the pigs, told the Nassau  that he blamed tourism for the lost pigs. “[Tourism] is blowing out of proportion,” he previously said. “Anybody [can bring] food there …. We have people giving the pigs beer, rum … all kinds of stuff.   Blogger Michelle Cehn said she was horrified at what she saw when she visited the island during her honeymoon recently.  She claimed she found hungry hordes of pigs and ten to 15 little piglets, many with cuts and wounds all over their bodies. I started to worry that all of these pigs were suffering from severe burns from being exposed to the strong Caribbean sunshine day after day, she said. Most of the tourists I saw there were not aware of any safety precautions they should take when interacting with the pigs. And the things I saw them do for the sake of a photo were cringeworthy. It’s amazing there are not already stories circling about serious injuries at Pig Island, but it’s only a matter of time. Michelle's comments about the alleged mistreatment of the animals have also been echoed on Tripadvisor.  While most reviews are excellent or good, some show the dark side and dangers of interacting with the wild animals. One reviewer claimed: The pigs are very aggressive both in the water, and on the beach. Before you leave the boat, you are told to never turn your back on the pigs (one girl on our boat did, and she got bitten. Broke the skin). They added: I couldn't get back on the boat to leave fast enough. Another anonymous commenter said: Huge and some aggressive, because they want to eat.  They continued: People were feeding the pigs all sorts of things, hugging the pigs, trying to make them do tricks, and picking up the baby pigs. UK-based livestock manager Claire Elson, who works at a farm in the south east of England, explained why the pigs may be displaying certain behaviours. She told the : If they're biting they obviously feel in an uncomfortable position. Too much picking up can stress them out, but it's hard to say with what they've been used to. Pigs have been known to be living on beaches so it's not unusual for them to be in that environment but they tend to have their mud wallows which they use for moisturiser and it protects them from the sun. Any animal could be at risk from getting sunburnt but it depends on their surroundings - they will probably have adapted to their surrounds there.  They're really intelligent so they will go away from danger - if they're in a dangerous positions - they wouldn't go down there. But if people without the knowledge of how to handle them are picking them up that could hurt them and that could stress them out. They will go for you - they have a bark - you don't normally hear - it takes a lot to upset a pig as they are fairly chilled out creatures. If it's early in the morning and they are wanting food they'll be more eager to get to it - they pay no attention to us - that's the first priority on their mind - it might make them more anxious Addressing claims that people have been seen feeding the pigs alcohol, she said: Well it's not even good for humans so it definitely isn't something people should be feeding to pigs. It will upset their stomach and make them ill. People just need to respect that they're wild animals and their way of life - if people are going to want to get close make sure they do that safely. If (the pig) shows signs that it doesn't want to be touched, like barking or biting - leave it alone.
